intro: Phacelia rupestris, commonly known as the cliff phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous regions. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Phacelia rupestris is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species in dry climates.
